title: Strictly Come Dancing Emma Barton juggling EastEnders and training
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Strictly Come Dancing star Anton du Beke has spoken about how his dance partner Emma Barton manages to juggle training with her filming schedule on EastEnders.

The soap star plays Honey on the BBC soap, and is currently in the middle of a storyline in which her character is struggling to believe her partner is cheating on her.

With EastEnders on three days a week there’s lots to get done, which means she hasn’t had time to get in the dance studio with Anton as much as he’d like.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Speaking to presenters Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield on This Morning, he was asked how Emma was balancing the day with rehearsing for their Paso Doble on Saturday.

He explained: ‘She is constantly working on EastEnders. She’s doing two massive jobs.

‘We only got into the studio yesterday and then I’m gonna see her this afternoon and we’re gonna work on it until late.

‘She hasn’t had a lot of time but she’s such a hard worker and such a pro.’

Anton praised his ‘hard working’ partner Emma (Picture: PA)

Anton has also had his first spray tan in readiness for the more revealing shirt he will put on for the Paso. And he cheekily admitted that his wife Hannah is a big fan.

‘She has me parading around the bedroom with a dressing gown,’ he joked.

The professional dancer was recently at the centre of probably one of the funniest moments of Strictly when judge Craig Revel Horwood mistakenly thought he was wearing false teeth for his Austin Powers inspired routine.

Anton’s teeth are all him, folks (Picture: ITV/REX)

The 53-year-old professional dancer has often been bundled with the older celebrity contestants in Strictly history, including the likes of Anne Widdecombe and Judy Murray.

So he was over the moon to be paired with Emma, saying during the show launch: ‘So this is what it feels like. Oh book me in till Christmas.’

He added: ‘I apologise. I know it seemed a bit sort of over reaction, but if you’ve been through what I’ve been through, I can’t begin to tell you.’

This Morning airs weekdays from 10.30am on ITV.

description: Strictly Come Dancing Emma Barton juggling EastEnders and training as Anton Du Beke reveals fears
